metadata.title: CVE-2019-19526 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.3.9, there is a use-after-free bug that can becaused by a malicious USB device in the drivers/nfc/pn533/usb.c driver, akaCID-6af3aa57a098.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19526` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-72-generic - 4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-72-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-72-lowlatency - 4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-72-generic - 4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-72-lowlatency - 4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1007-kvm - 4.4.0-1007.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1056-aws - 4.15.0-1056.58~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1064-azure - 4.15.0-1064.69
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1050-gcp - 4.15.0-1050.53
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1030-oracle - 4.15.0-1030.33~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.2.0-1013-raspi2 - 4.2.0-1013.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-72.81~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1007.12').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.58~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1064.69').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1050.53').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.33~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
